title.narrative: 2.7 DISTRICT CHILD JUSTICE SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, children and adolescents who are victims, witnesses, offenders or who are in contact with the law for any other reason, have access to child and gender sensitive formal justice., which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, in selected areas (the most disadvantaged districts and municipalities), social sector systems are providing integrated, quality services to fulfil the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents and women with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, children and adolescents who are victims, witnesses, offenders or who are incontact with the law for any other reason, have access to child and gender sensitive formal justice.

description.narrative: UNICEF in collaboration with Juvenile Justice Coordination Committee (JJCC) published juvinile justice bench book with the aim to guide the judges to deliver fair judgments on cases related to children in a gender and child friendly manner. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: % of child and adolescent cases (gender disaggregated) in contact with the formal justice system in the priority districts handled according to child- and gender-sensitive procedures

actual.value: 2017:100 per cent of relevant cases (235) in contact with the formal justice system were handled accordingly to child and gender sensitive procedures. Cases were related to theft, rape, attempt to rape, public offences, drug smuggling and involved in ammunition.

title.narrative: Number of priority districts with Child Justice system established and functioning [HR trained, Gvt budget allocated, case IMS used, Child-friendly rooms equipped, Legal aid committees established/trained, JJCC established]

actual.value: 2017:A total of 25 districts have trained human resources, government budget allocation, case IMS, child-friendly rooms, legal aid committees and district JJCC as the elements of Child Justice System.

title.narrative: Children's/adolescents and women's protection concerns incorporated in national curricula for pre-service and in-service training of law enforcement and judicial authorities

baseline.value: 16-day training incorporated in pre-service curriculum for mid-level police

target.value: 2017:Protection in curriculum for all levels of police, judges, prosecutors, court-appointed lawyers, Attorney's Office Legal Aid lawyers, Chief District Officers

actual.value: 2017:Nepal Police has developed curricula for pre-service and in-service training on Juvenile Justice and Gender Based Violence which addresses the protection concerns of children in conflict with law as well as the victims.
